title: How to Make Taquitos

steps.headline: Heat the oil until it reaches 350°F(177°C).
steps.description: Place a heavy-bottomed pan with straight sides on the stove. Pour 2-inches (5-cm) of vegetable oil into the pan, and heat it over medium heat until the oil hits the right temperature on a deep fry thermometer. You can substitute a candy thermometer for the deep fryer thermometer.

steps.headline: Combine the chicken, cheese, salsa, and cumin.
steps.description: While the oil is heating, add 2 cups (250 g) of shredded chicken, 1 cup (100 g) of shredded mild white cheddar cheese, ½ cup (130 g) of chunky salsa, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of ground cumin to a medium bowl. Toss the ingredients together so they're well mixed. You can use leftover chicken or a rotisserie chicken from the grocery store. Feel free to substitute your favorite cheese, such as sharp cheddar, pepper jack, or monterey jack, for the mild white cheddar.

steps.headline: Spoon the chicken mixture onto the tortillas.
steps.description: For the taquitos, you'll need (8) 6-inch (15-cm) flour tortillas. Spread about ¼ cup (48 g) of the chicken mixture in the center of each tortilla to fill the taquitos.

steps.headline: Roll up the tortillas and secure with a toothpick.
steps.description: Once you've spread the filling over the tortilla, twist it up tightly over the chicken mixture to create a long cigar-like shape. Secure the taquito in the center with a toothpick.

steps.headline: Place the taquitos in the oil and fry them until crispy.
steps.description: When the oil is hot enough, add the taquitos to the pan two or three at a time. Allow them to fry until they are golden brown, flipping them every so often. It should take about three minutes for the taquitos to fry up crisp.

steps.headline: Drain the taquitos and repeat with the remaining tortillas.
steps.description: When the taquitos are crisp and golden brown, use a pair of tongs to lift them out of the pan. Place them on a plate lined with paper-towel to drain, and repeat the process with the remaining taquitos.

steps.headline: Serve the taquitos with salsa and sour cream.
steps.description: Once you've fried all of the taquitos, set them on a platter for serving. Place bowls of salsa and sour cream beside the taquitos for dipping.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and grease a baking sheet.
steps.description: Set the oven to 400°F (200°C), and allow it to fully preheat. Next, line a baking sheet with foil and lightly spray it with nonstick cooking spray. Set it aside for the moment.

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of vegetable oil to a large skillet. Set it on the stove, and allow it to heat on medium for 2 to 3 minutes. You can substitute canola oil if you prefer.

steps.headline: Cook the onion and garlic until they're soft.
steps.description: After the oil has heated for a couple of minutes, add a finely chopped medium onion and a minced clove of garlic to the pan. Allow them to cook for 3 minutes, or until the onions soften. Stir the onion and garlic regularly to ensure that they cook evenly.

steps.headline: Mix in the beef and cook it until browned.
steps.description: When the onion and garlic are soft, add ¾ pound (340 g) of lean ground beef to the pan. Break it up with a wooden spoon, and cook the meat until it is browned, which should take 3 to 5 minutes. You can substitute any ground meat that you like, such as turkey, chicken, or pork, for the beef if you prefer.

steps.headline: Stir in the salsa, chili powder, salt, and pepper and cook for 10 minutes.
steps.description: When the ground beef is browned, add ½ cup (130 g) of salsa, 2 teaspoons (5 g) of chili powder, ½ teaspoon (3 g) of salt, and ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of pepper to the pan. Mix well to ensure that the ingredients are well blended and reduce the heat to low. Allow the mixture to cook for another 10 minutes. You can substitute taco seasoning for the chili powder, salt, and pepper if you prefer.

steps.headline: Microwave the tortillas until they're pliable.
steps.description: Set (10) 6-inch (15-cm) flour tortillas on a microwave-safe plate, and place a wet paper towel over them. Heat the tortillas in the microwave on high for approximately 45 seconds, or until they are soft and pliable.

steps.headline: Spoon the beef mixture onto the tortillas and sprinkle with the cheese.
steps.description: Once the tortillas are pliable, spread ¼ cup (60 g) of the beef mixture over the center of each. Use ½ cup of shredded (50 g) cheddar cheese to sprinkle over the beef on all of the tortillas. You can substitute your favorite cheese, such as pepper jack or monterey jack, for the cheddar.

steps.headline: Roll up the taquitos and place them on the baking sheet.
steps.description: When the tortillas are covered with the beef mixture and cheese, carefully roll up each taquito to close it. Set the taquitos on the lined baking sheet with the seams facing down.

steps.headline: Coat the taquitos with oil.
steps.description: Dip a pastry brush in some vegetable oil and lightly brush it over the taquitos. Make sure to coat the tortillas on all of the exposed sides.

steps.headline: Bake the taquitos until crispy.
steps.description: Once they're coated with oil, place the taquitos in the preheated oven. Allow them to bake for 8 to 12 minutes, or until they're crispy and lightly browned.

steps.headline: Serve the taquitos with sour cream and salsa.
steps.description: When they're finished baking, remove the taquitos from the oven. Use tongs to place them on a platter, and serve them with sour cream and/or salsa for dipping.

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) of canola oil to a large, nonstick skillet. Allow it to heat over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Cook the onion and garlic until they're soft.
steps.description: When the oil is heated, add ½ cup (75 g) of finely chopped onions and 1 teaspoon (3 g) of minced garlic to the skillet. Let them cook for 3 minutes, or until the onions are soft.

steps.headline: Mix in the veggie ground round, spices, and green chilies and cook for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Once the onion is soft, add 1 ½ cups (248 g) of veggie ground round, ¼ teaspoon (1 ½ g) of salt, ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of cumin, ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of ground red pepper, and a 4.5 ounce (127 g) can of chopped green chilies that hasn't been undrained to the skillet. Stir well to combine the ingredients, and allow it to cook for another 5 minutes. Veggie ground round is usually soy protein crumbles, but you can use any vegetarian ground meat substitute that you like.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: While the veggie ground round mixture is cooking, set the oven to 425°F (220°C). Allow it to fully preheat.

steps.headline: Bring the broth to a boil.
steps.description: Add 2 cups (473 ml) of vegetable broth to a large saucepan. Place it on the stove on high heat, and allow the broth to come to a boil.

steps.headline: Lower the heat and simmer the broth.
steps.description: Once the broth has come to a boil, reduce the heat to medium. Let it simmer gently.

steps.headline: Dip the tortillas in the broth and drain on paper towel.
steps.description: For the taquitos, you'll need (16) 6-inch (15-cm) corn tortillas. Use pair of tongs to dip each tortilla in the hot vegetable broth for 2 to 3 seconds to soften them. Place the tortillas on a paper towel to drain slightly.

steps.headline: Spoon the filling onto the tortilla and top with cheese.
steps.description: When all of the tortillas are softened, spread approximately 1 tablespoon (20 g) of the veggie filling over the center of the tortilla. Use ⅔ cup (65 g) of shredded cheddar cheese to sprinkle over the filling on all of the tortillas tortilla.

steps.headline: Roll up the taquitos and place on a baking sheet.
steps.description: With the filling and cheese inside, tightly roll up each taquito. Place them on a baking sheet lightly coated with nonstick cooking spray. Make sure that the seams are facing down when you place the taquitos on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Spray the taquitos with cooking spray and bake until they're crisp.
steps.description: When the taquitos are on the baking sheet, lightly mist them with cooking spray. Place them in the oven, and allow them to bake for about 13 minutes, or until they're crisp and golden brown.

steps.headline: Serve the taquitos with salsa.
steps.description: When the taquitos are finished baking, use a pair of tongs to transfer them to a platter. Fill a small bowl with salsa, and serve it with the taquitos for dipping.

text: Preparing Chicken Taquitos Heat the oil until it reaches 350°F(177°C). Place a heavy-bottomed pan with straight sides on the stove. Pour 2-inches (5-cm) of vegetable oil into the pan, and heat it over medium heat until the oil hits the right temperature on a deep fry thermometer. You can substitute a candy thermometer for the deep fryer thermometer. Combine the chicken, cheese, salsa, and cumin. While the oil is heating, add 2 cups (250 g) of shredded chicken, 1 cup (100 g) of shredded mild white cheddar cheese, ½ cup (130 g) of chunky salsa, and ½ teaspoon (1 g) of ground cumin to a medium bowl. Toss the ingredients together so they're well mixed. You can use leftover chicken or a rotisserie chicken from the grocery store. Feel free to substitute your favorite cheese, such as sharp cheddar, pepper jack, or monterey jack, for the mild white cheddar. Spoon the chicken mixture onto the tortillas. For the taquitos, you'll need (8) 6-inch (15-cm) flour tortillas. Spread about ¼ cup (48 g) of the chicken mixture in the center of each tortilla to fill the taquitos. Roll up the tortillas and secure with a toothpick. Once you've spread the filling over the tortilla, twist it up tightly over the chicken mixture to create a long cigar-like shape. Secure the taquito in the center with a toothpick. Place the taquitos in the oil and fry them until crispy. When the oil is hot enough, add the taquitos to the pan two or three at a time. Allow them to fry until they are golden brown, flipping them every so often. It should take about three minutes for the taquitos to fry up crisp. Drain the taquitos and repeat with the remaining tortillas. When the taquitos are crisp and golden brown, use a pair of tongs to lift them out of the pan. Place them on a plate lined with paper-towel to drain, and repeat the process with the remaining taquitos. Serve the taquitos with salsa and sour cream. Once you've fried all of the taquitos, set them on a platter for serving. Place bowls of salsa and sour cream beside the taquitos for dipping. Whipping Up Ground Beef Taquitos Preheat the oven and grease a baking sheet. Set the oven to 400°F (200°C), and allow it to fully preheat. Next, line a baking sheet with foil and lightly spray it with nonstick cooking spray. Set it aside for the moment. Heat the oil. Add 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of vegetable oil to a large skillet. Set it on the stove, and allow it to heat on medium for 2 to 3 minutes. You can substitute canola oil if you prefer. Cook the onion and garlic until they're soft. After the oil has heated for a couple of minutes, add a finely chopped medium onion and a minced clove of garlic to the pan. Allow them to cook for 3 minutes, or until the onions soften. Stir the onion and garlic regularly to ensure that they cook evenly. Mix in the beef and cook it until browned. When the onion and garlic are soft, add ¾ pound (340 g) of lean ground beef to the pan. Break it up with a wooden spoon, and cook the meat until it is browned, which should take 3 to 5 minutes. You can substitute any ground meat that you like, such as turkey, chicken, or pork, for the beef if you prefer. Stir in the salsa, chili powder, salt, and pepper and cook for 10 minutes. When the ground beef is browned, add ½ cup (130 g) of salsa, 2 teaspoons (5 g) of chili powder, ½ teaspoon (3 g) of salt, and ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of pepper to the pan. Mix well to ensure that the ingredients are well blended and reduce the heat to low. Allow the mixture to cook for another 10 minutes. You can substitute taco seasoning for the chili powder, salt, and pepper if you prefer. Microwave the tortillas until they're pliable. Set (10) 6-inch (15-cm) flour tortillas on a microwave-safe plate, and place a wet paper towel over them. Heat the tortillas in the microwave on high for approximately 45 seconds, or until they are soft and pliable. Spoon the beef mixture onto the tortillas and sprinkle with the cheese. Once the tortillas are pliable, spread ¼ cup (60 g) of the beef mixture over the center of each. Use ½ cup of shredded (50 g) cheddar cheese to sprinkle over the beef on all of the tortillas. You can substitute your favorite cheese, such as pepper jack or monterey jack, for the cheddar. Roll up the taquitos and place them on the baking sheet. When the tortillas are covered with the beef mixture and cheese, carefully roll up each taquito to close it. Set the taquitos on the lined baking sheet with the seams facing down. Coat the taquitos with oil. Dip a pastry brush in some vegetable oil and lightly brush it over the taquitos. Make sure to coat the tortillas on all of the exposed sides. Bake the taquitos until crispy. Once they're coated with oil, place the taquitos in the preheated oven. Allow them to bake for 8 to 12 minutes, or until they're crispy and lightly browned. Serve the taquitos with sour cream and salsa. When they're finished baking, remove the taquitos from the oven. Use tongs to place them on a platter, and serve them with sour cream and/or salsa for dipping. Fixing Vegetarian Taquitos Heat the oil. Add 1 teaspoon (5 ml) of canola oil to a large, nonstick skillet. Allow it to heat over medium-high heat for about 3 minutes. Cook the onion and garlic until they're soft. When the oil is heated, add ½ cup (75 g) of finely chopped onions and 1 teaspoon (3 g) of minced garlic to the skillet. Let them cook for 3 minutes, or until the onions are soft. Mix in the veggie ground round, spices, and green chilies and cook for 5 minutes. Once the onion is soft, add 1 ½ cups (248 g) of veggie ground round, ¼ teaspoon (1 ½ g) of salt, ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of cumin, ¼ teaspoon (½ g) of ground red pepper, and a 4.5 ounce (127 g) can of chopped green chilies that hasn't been undrained to the skillet. Stir well to combine the ingredients, and allow it to cook for another 5 minutes. Veggie ground round is usually soy protein crumbles, but you can use any vegetarian ground meat substitute that you like. Preheat the oven. While the veggie ground round mixture is cooking, set the oven to 425°F (220°C). Allow it to fully preheat. Bring the broth to a boil. Add 2 cups (473 ml) of vegetable broth to a large saucepan. Place it on the stove on high heat, and allow the broth to come to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer the broth. Once the broth has come to a boil, reduce the heat to medium. Let it simmer gently. Dip the tortillas in the broth and drain on paper towel. For the taquitos, you'll need (16) 6-inch (15-cm) corn tortillas. Use pair of tongs to dip each tortilla in the hot vegetable broth for 2 to 3 seconds to soften them. Place the tortillas on a paper towel to drain slightly. Spoon the filling onto the tortilla and top with cheese. When all of the tortillas are softened, spread approximately 1 tablespoon (20 g) of the veggie filling over the center of the tortilla. Use ⅔ cup (65 g) of shredded cheddar cheese to sprinkle over the filling on all of the tortillas tortilla. Roll up the taquitos and place on a baking sheet. With the filling and cheese inside, tightly roll up each taquito. Place them on a baking sheet lightly coated with nonstick cooking spray. Make sure that the seams are facing down when you place the taquitos on the baking sheet. Spray the taquitos with cooking spray and bake until they're crisp. When the taquitos are on the baking sheet, lightly mist them with cooking spray. Place them in the oven, and allow them to bake for about 13 minutes, or until they're crisp and golden brown. Serve the taquitos with salsa. When the taquitos are finished baking, use a pair of tongs to transfer them to a platter. Fill a small bowl with salsa, and serve it with the taquitos for dipping.
